intro: Tococa lancifolia var. anaphysca, commonly known as the Amazonian stimulant plant, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other plants like coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its most notable feature is the presence of psychoactive alkaloids in its leaves, which have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. Due to its medicinal and recreational potential, it has attracted scientific interest for further research.
